transportAdvice: Phoenix is a sprawling, car-dependent city where walking between attractions is generally impractical due to distances and heat; a light rail system connects some central areas and suburbs, but renting a car or using taxis is the most practical option for reaching most tourist destinations.

weather.description: Mild and sunny winter days with cool nights, ideal for outdoor sightseeing.
Pleasant and warm with plenty of sunshine, one of the most comfortable months to visit.
Warm spring weather begins, great for hiking and outdoor activities before summer heat arrives.
Warm and dry with long sunny days, excellent conditions for exploring the desert landscape.
Heat builds significantly; mornings are still manageable but afternoons can be intense.
Extremely hot and dry; outdoor activities should be limited to early morning or evening hours.
Peak summer heat combined with the onset of monsoon season brings occasional dramatic thunderstorms.
Monsoon storms continue with high humidity by local standards; still very hot throughout the day.
Heat begins to ease slightly toward month's end; monsoon activity tapers off.
Comfortable and sunny autumn weather returns, making it a popular time for outdoor recreation.
Mild and pleasant with cool evenings; one of the best months for hiking and sightseeing.
Cool and sunny winter conditions with crisp nights, ideal for visitors escaping colder climates.
